docs.lead_paragraph: EU nations reached a compromise on long-awaited reforms to the carbon emissions market on Tuesday, moving the European Union closer to adopting key rules to deliver on its pledge to cut greenhouse gas emissions under the Paris climate accord.

headline.main: EU Nations Thrash Out Deal on Carbon Market Reform
headline.print_headline: EU Nations Thrash Out Deal on Carbon Market Reform

docs.snippet: EU nations reached a compromise on long-awaited reforms to the carbon emissions market on Tuesday, moving the European Union closer to adopting key rules to deliver on its pledge to cut greenhouse gas emissions under the Paris climate accord....

docs.lead_paragraph: About 1,300 suspected militants were arrested in a sweep of hideouts in Pakistan's largest province of Punjab, police said Friday.

headline.main: Hundreds of Suspected Militants Detained in Pakistan Sweep
headline.print_headline: Hundreds of Suspected Militants Detained in Pakistan Sweep

docs.snippet: About 1,300 suspected militants were arrested in a sweep of hideouts in Pakistan's largest province of Punjab, police said Friday....

docs.lead_paragraph: The flight deck of the USS Carl Vinson shakes as a succession of F-18 fighter jets are catapulted into take-off, emitting a thunderous noise and leaving white mist in their wake.

headline.main: U.S. Carrier Puts on Show of 'Commitment', Not Power, in South China Sea

docs.lead_paragraph: The European Union says it is in contact with the World Bank to look at the issue of a loan to Greece.

docs.lead_paragraph: A double amputee who uses a wheelchair is suing for access to the grave of his two-legged cat, arguing that the Ohio property's new owners discriminated against him by installing landscaping barriers that block his way.

headline.main: Double Amputee Sues for Access to Grave of His 2-Legged Cat
headline.print_headline: Double Amputee Sues for Access to Grave of His 2-Legged Cat

docs.snippet: A double amputee who uses a wheelchair is suing for access to the grave of his two-legged cat, arguing that the Ohio property's new owners discriminated against him by installing landscaping barriers that block his way....

docs.lead_paragraph: Pittsburgh Pirates infielder Jung Ho Kang received a suspended two-year prison sentence for fleeing the scene after crashing a car into a guardrail while driving under the influence of alcohol.

headline.main: Pirates' Kang Gets Suspended 2-Year Jail Term for Crash
headline.print_headline: Pirates' Kang Gets Suspended 2-Year Jail Term for Crash

docs.snippet: Pittsburgh Pirates infielder Jung Ho Kang received a suspended two-year prison sentence for fleeing the scene after crashing a car into a guardrail while driving under the influence of alcohol....

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States has carried out another wave of precision strikes in Yemen targeting al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula, two U.S. officials told Reuters on Friday, a day after the Pentagon acknowledged carrying out more than 20 strikes.

headline.main: U.S. Carries Out More Strikes in Yemen, US Officials Tell Reuters
headline.print_headline: U.S. Carries Out More Strikes in Yemen, US Officials Tell Reuters

docs.lead_paragraph: A Michigan lawmaker who quit office amid a sex scandal in 2015 is expected to face trial this spring on a perjury charge.

docs.lead_paragraph: Decisions about public gatherings are made at a local level in Germany, Chancellor Angela Merkel said on Friday, after Turkey accused Berlin of scandalous behavior in cancelling rallies of Turkish citizens where key Turkish ministers were to speak.

headline.main: Merkel Pushes Back Against Turkey's Criticism After Meeting Bans
headline.print_headline: Merkel Pushes Back Against Turkey's Criticism After Meeting Bans
